meanings.sent1: The video game was so addictive that I couldn't stop playing it.
meanings.sent2: The addictive nature of social media keeps people scrolling for hours.
meanings.sent3: His addiction to chocolate was so addictive that he always had a stash in his desk.
meanings.sent4: The addictive pull of the song made it impossible to get out of my head.
meanings.sent5: The addictive taste of the cookies made them irresistible to everyone.

meanings.definition: Having a strong inclination to do, use, or indulge in something repeatedly
meanings.sent1: She had an addictive habit of checking her phone every few minutes.
meanings.sent2: His addictive personality led him to try every new hobby he came across.
meanings.sent3: It was addictive how she always had a new joke to tell.
meanings.sent4: The addictive nature of his enthusiasm was contagious to everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The addictive smell of fresh popcorn drew people to the concession stand.

meanings.definition: Tending to cause a strong desire to continue doing or using something
meanings.sent1: The addictive aroma of freshly baked bread filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The new TV series had an addictive storyline that kept viewers hooked.
meanings.sent3: Her addictive laughter was infectious, making everyone around her smile.
meanings.sent4: The addictive rhythm of the music had everyone dancing in no time.
meanings.sent5: The addictive colors of the painting drew me in and held my gaze.
